metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20845 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Division-by-zero vulnerabilities in the functions pi_next_pcrl, pi_next_cprl, and pi_next_rpcl in openmj2/pi.c in OpenJPEG through 2.3.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash). It was discovered that OpenJPEG incorrectly handled certain image files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

notes.Note: ebarretto> Marking emscripten ignored as openjpeg2 code is only for test/example. mdeslaur> Ubuntu openjpeg2 packages are built with BUILD_MJ2:BOOL=OFF, so the vulnerable code is not compiled ccdm94> the openjpeg package does not include the file patched by commit c5bd64ea146. Before the refactoring, there was a single pi.c file, which according to the code itself, seems to be affected by this vulnerability, however, it looks like the vulnerability in this case is related to CVE-2018-14423 instead, which has a very similar patch (bd88611ed9a).

criterions.comment: blender: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
emscripten: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
insighttoolkit4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
